page.title: 08RECREATION FACILITIES
page.content: {The Victoria Community}centre was opened in 1981. It consists of three buildings: the Oakley, the Meredith and the Newdigate. Many activities are held there including keepfit, judo, football, badminton and pop-mobility. { {The Lyceum Theatre}was built in 1887 at a cost of Â£7,000 with seats for 1250 people. Burnt down in 1910, a new theatre was opened in 1911. The Corporation bought it in 1955. Plays are performed by touring repertory companies and it is used for the scouts 'Gangshow' and amateur operatic productions. { {Crewe Alexandra Football Club}was founded in 1876 and is now in Division Four. Their ground is in Gresty Road near to the railway station. The average attendance is about 2,300.
